alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Morris County through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parsippany, or near Morristown, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Chatham, Boonton, Morris Plains, Mountain Lakes, Parsippany and Hanover Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 42 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
